questions.question: Where do both the opening and closing scenes of the "Black Cowboy, Wild Horses" take place?

choices.answer: on a wide treeless plain
at the edge of a smal frontier town
on a cliff that overlooks a corral
in a dream that the main character has

questions.question: What is Bob Lemmons special skill?

choices.answer: He can paint the open plains
He can locate pastures for horses to graze
He can round up a herd of wild horses
He can find injured colts

questions.question: Which statement best describes Bob Lemmons?

choices.answer: He can't read words, but he can read animal tracks.
He can't ride a horse, but he can find a herd of horses.
He can't read words, bhe he can write messages using pictures.
He can't read animal tracks, but he can round up wild horses alone.

questions.question: In the climax of the story how does Bob take control of the herd?

choices.answer: He puts ropes on the horses and leads them to the corral
He kills the rattle snake and therby wins the trust of the horses
He has his horse defeat the stallion and take its place as the leader
He leads the horses into a ravine during a storm

questions.question: What is the exposition of a story?

choices.answer: The most exciting part
Where the characters, setting, and conflicts are introduced
Where all of the conflicts are resolved
Where the ending is revealed

questions.question: How does the character of Bob Lemmons respond to events throughout the story?

choices.answer: He reluctantly decides to settle down and find the mustangs
He prides himself on cleverly tricking the mustangs
He patiently focuses on finding and herding the mustangs
He questions his own actions every step of the way

questions.question: What does the word milled mean?

choices.answer: To wander around
To wait quietly
To applaud
To stand in line

questions.question: What does skittered mean?

choices.answer: to shake in terror
to dash quickly
to tiptoe quietly
to munch noisily

questions.question: What does the word quivering mean?

choices.answer: To dash quickly
To shake  nervously
To dance
To gobble noisily

questions.question: What is the most important way in which Bob Lemmons is similar to the horses?

choices.answer: He loves the wide open plains.
He has a distrust of most people.
He wants to contribute to a team.
He feels compassion for humans.

questions.question: What talent does Bob have that allows him to round up wild horses on his way?

choices.answer: He can ride any wild horse without fear.
He can calm the horses with a few words.
He can make the horses think he is one of them.
He has leadership qualities that wild horses respect.

questions.question: What does the reader learn in the exposition of "Black Cowboy, Wild Horses?"

choices.answer: The reader learns about Bob's background.
The reader learn
The reader learns about the threat of rattlesnakes.
The reader learns how Bob was able to lead horses across the plain.

questions.question: Which of these events best represents the climax of the story?

choices.answer: The death of the colt
Vultures circling over the herd
Warrior's fight with the mustang
The arrival of the herd at the corral

questions.question: Which of the sentences uses a present tense verb?

choices.answer: He bought a new suitcase.
The snow is melting quickly.
The bus will stop at our resort.
The slopes were challenging.

questions.question: Which helping verb indicates future tense?

choices.answer: Am
Is
Are
Will

questions.question: What is the past tense of to grow?

choices.answer: is growing
grew
are growing
will grow

questions.question: Who or what is the main subject of "Monkey Master"?

choices.answer: a scientist who studies the painting made by monkeys
an orangutan whose painting the writer does not care for
a chimpanzees whose paintings are featrued in an exhibition
an artist who collects the paintings done by chimpanzees

questions.question: How did Morris help Congo make his paintings?

choices.answer: Morris drew shapes that Congo filled in with colors.
Morris showed Congo how to hold a paint brush.
Morris showed Congo examples of abstract art.
Morris gave Congo art supplies and a special high chair to help him paint.

questions.question: Which of the following background information could have been covered in the exhibition of ape paintings?

choices.answer: how much each painting is worth
which animal painted which painting
to what extent Morris influenced Congo's paintings
whether Picasso truly valued the paintings in the exhibit

questions.question: True of False:  A purist is someone who enjoys eating different types of food.

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: What does the word aesthetic mean?

choices.answer: how something looks
how something smells
how something feels
how much something costs

questions.question: Which of the following is the best definition of abstract as it applies to art?

choices.answer: Using shapes and colors to depict something real
Using shapes and colors to represent sad emotions
using shapes and colors that do not represent things
None of the above

questions.question: Which of the following statements is the MOST true?

choices.answer: Congo's work is scary because it shows that he cares a great deal about art
Congo's work shows a sense of form and design that is eerily like a human's
Congo's work is neat and tidy.
Congo's work shows balance because he has real talent for picking colors.

questions.question: What is one meaning of the Greek suffix-ist?

choices.answer: more than
one who comes from
missing from
one who believes in
